issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H1) = 48pt (generous). Large space above signals new major section.
issues.observation: The H1 'Heading Level 1' appears at the very top of the document with approximately 32pt of space above it, consistent with the windowTopInset rather than the generous 48pt heading space above.
issues.deviation: Since H1 is the first element in the document, the space above it is governed by the windowTopInset (32pt spacious) rather than the headingSpaceAbove value. This is likely correct behavior for the first element, but the PRD specifies 48pt above H1 headings. The effective top margin appears to be ~32pt which matches FR-6 windowTopInset.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H2) = 32pt (spacious). Proportional reduction from H1; still clearly a section break.
issues.observation: The space above H2 'Heading Level 2' appears to be approximately 24-28pt rather than the specified 32pt. The gap between H1 and H2 looks somewhat compressed.
issues.deviation: The vertical gap above H2 appears slightly less than the specified 32pt spacious primitive. The heading still reads as a section break but the spacing feels tighter than specified.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceBelow (H1) = 16pt (standard). Heading belongs to what follows -- asymmetric margin creates visual binding.
issues.observation: The space below H1 before H2 appears to be roughly consistent with the combined effect of H1 spaceBelow (16pt) + H2 spaceAbove (32pt) = 48pt total. The total gap between H1 and H2 appears to be approximately 40-44pt.
issues.deviation: The combined spacing between H1 and H2 appears slightly compressed compared to the expected 48pt (16pt below H1 + 32pt above H2). This is a minor deviation that is difficult to measure precisely from the screenshot.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H2) = 32pt (spacious). Proportional reduction from H1; still clearly a section break.
issues.observation: The space above H2 in the light theme appears to match the dark theme measurement of approximately 24-28pt.
issues.deviation: Same deviation as ISS-002 in the dark theme. The H2 space above appears slightly less than the specified 32pt. Consistency between themes is maintained, suggesting this is a systematic spacing value rather than a rendering bug.

issues.specificationExcerpt: componentPadding = 12pt (cozy). Internal padding for code blocks, blockquotes.
issues.observation: The code block internal padding appears to be approximately 12-16pt on the left side. The top padding before the 'swift' language label also appears to be in the cozy range.
issues.deviation: The code block padding appears to be within acceptable range of the specification. The 'swift' language label at the top-left of the code block has consistent padding. No significant deviation detected but precise measurement from screenshot is challenging.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Heading hierarchy: headingSpaceAbove H1 (48pt) > H2 (32pt) > H3 (24pt). Key invariant: headings have more space above than below.
issues.observation: The spacing above H4, H5, and H6 appears progressively tighter but the differences between H4, H5, and H6 are very small, making the hierarchy less visually distinct at the lower heading levels.
issues.deviation: While the PRD only specifies spacing for H1-H3, the heading hierarchy from H4 through H6 shows minimal visual differentiation in spacing. The headings themselves decrease in size correctly, but the spacing between H3/H4/H5/H6 levels feels quite uniform rather than progressively scaled.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H2) | 32pt (spacious) | Proportional reduction from H1; still clearly a section break
issues.observation: The vertical space above H2 'Calibration Heading Two' appears slightly less than the expected 32pt spacious primitive. Visually it reads closer to 24pt (relaxed).
issues.deviation: Space above H2 may be approximately 24pt rather than the specified 32pt, reducing the visual distinction between H2 and H3 section breaks.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H2) | 32pt (spacious) | Proportional reduction from H1; still clearly a section break
issues.observation: Same as dark theme: the vertical space above H2 'Calibration Heading Two' appears slightly compressed relative to the 32pt specification.
issues.deviation: Space above H2 appears closer to 24pt than the specified 32pt, consistent with the dark theme observation.

issues.specificationExcerpt: headingSpaceAbove (H3) | 24pt (relaxed) | Sub-section signal; less dramatic than H2
issues.observation: The space above H3 'Calibration Heading Three' appears very similar to the space above H2, making H2 and H3 section breaks feel almost identical in visual weight.
issues.deviation: If H2 space above is compressed to ~24pt and H3 space above is also ~24pt, the heading hierarchy proportional spacing is flattened â€” H2 and H3 breaks are not sufficiently differentiated.

issues.specificationExcerpt: blockquoteBorderPadding | 12pt (cozy) | Internal padding from blockquote border to content
issues.observation: The blockquote's left border is barely visible in the dark theme. The border appears to be rendered but its color has very low contrast against the dark background, making the blockquote's structural indicator hard to perceive.
issues.deviation: Blockquote left border contrast is insufficient in the dark theme. While the padding may be correct, the border itself is not clearly visible, undermining the blockquote's visual distinction.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Success: the rendered diagram image displayed inline in the document
issues.observation: Under the 'Flowchart' heading, instead of a rendered diagram image, there appears to be only a small loading spinner or minimal element. The diagram is not rendered as a full inline image.
issues.deviation: Diagrams are not displaying as rendered images inline in the document. They appear stuck in a loading state or rendered at an extremely small size, making the diagram content invisible.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Success: the rendered diagram image displayed inline in the document
issues.observation: Under the 'Flowchart' heading, the diagram is not rendered as a visible image. A small element or spinner is visible but no diagram content is shown.
issues.deviation: Same as dark theme: diagrams are not displaying as rendered images. The flowchart, sequence diagram, and other diagram types are not visible as rendered content.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Five diagram types are supported: Flowchart, Sequence, State, Class, ER
issues.observation: The document contains sections for Flowchart, Sequence Diagram, and Class Diagram. None of these show rendered diagram images. The diagrams appear to be either still loading or have failed to render without showing an error state.
issues.deviation: Cannot verify that any of the five supported diagram types render correctly, as none are displaying rendered content.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Diagram containers use theme-appropriate colors: Container background: backgroundSecondary from the active theme
issues.observation: No distinct diagram container with a secondary background color is visible. The diagram areas do not show a differentiated container background from the main document background.
issues.deviation: Cannot verify theme-appropriate container backgrounds since diagrams are not rendering with visible containers.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Diagram containers use theme-appropriate colors: Container background: backgroundSecondary from the active theme
issues.observation: No distinct diagram container with a secondary background color is visible in the light theme either.
issues.deviation: Cannot verify theme-appropriate container backgrounds since diagrams are not rendering with visible containers.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Error: a warning icon and error message if rendering fails
issues.observation: The small elements visible under diagram headings do not appear to be loading spinners or error indicators with warning icons and messages. The UI state is ambiguous.
issues.deviation: If diagrams failed to render, the error state (warning icon + error message) is not clearly displayed. If they are loading, the loading state appears incomplete or the spinner is very small.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Heading text: accent color (varies by heading level)
issues.observation: The 'Syntax Token Reference' H1 heading and 'Keywords' H2 heading both appear rendered in the same light/white foreground color rather than distinct accent colors that vary by heading level.
issues.deviation: Headings do not appear to use distinct accent colors per heading level as specified. Both H1 and H2 appear to use the same base text color (base0/base1) rather than Solarized accent colors.

issues.specificationExcerpt: Heading text: accent color (varies by heading level)
issues.observation: The 'Syntax Token Reference' H1 heading and 'Keywords' H2 heading both appear rendered in the same dark foreground color rather than distinct accent colors that vary by heading level.
issues.deviation: Headings do not appear to use distinct accent colors per heading level as specified. Both H1 and H2 appear to use the same base text color (base00/base01) rather than Solarized accent colors.

issues.specificationExcerpt: A language label is displayed above the code block when a language tag is present in the Markdown fence.
issues.observation: The code block under 'Keywords' shows 'swift' text that appears to be a language label positioned inside or at the top of the code block area.
issues.deviation: The language label 'swift' is present but appears rendered as small plain text within the code block area rather than as a visually distinct label above the code block. It could be more visually distinguished from the code content.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The overall composition in Solarized Dark is polished and visually appealing. The heading hierarchy is clear, body text is legible, syntax highlighting in the code block uses distinct colors (green for strings, blue for keywords, yellow for types), and the document margins frame the content generously.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The rendering meets the charter's standard of intentional design. The dark theme feels cohesive and professional. The code block stands out clearly from the document background with appropriate contrast. This is a strong daily-driver quality rendering.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The Solarized Light theme presents the same content with warm, paper-like tones. The code block has a slightly distinct cream/beige background. Syntax highlighting uses the Solarized Light palette with good token differentiation. All inline formatting (bold, italic, code, link, strikethrough) is clearly distinguishable.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The light theme rendering is equally polished as the dark theme. The warm Solarized palette creates a comfortable reading experience. The rendering feels like a well-designed document rather than a raw markdown dump. Meets the charter's quality threshold.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The vertical rhythm between consecutive headings (H1 through H6) creates a flowing cascade. The transition from headings to body text, then to paragraph spacing, then to the code block follows a logical visual hierarchy.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The vertical rhythm demonstrates careful spatial design. The Gestalt proximity principle is respected: headings bind visually to the content that follows them. The overall reading flow is natural and guided, suggesting thoughtful implementation of the spatial design language.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Cross-theme comparison shows consistent spacing, layout, and element positioning. The content occupies the same spatial regions in both themes. Document margins, heading positions, code block dimensions, and text flow are all consistent between dark and light themes.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Theme switching preserves spatial integrity perfectly. This demonstrates that the spacing system is theme-independent as expected. The rendering engine correctly separates layout concerns from theming concerns.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The inline code styling within body text is visible and distinct from surrounding text, using a monospace font with subtle background differentiation. The link text uses an accent color (appears cyan/teal) that is clearly identifiable as interactive. Strikethrough text renders with a visible line-through.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Inline element styling demonstrates attention to detail. Each inline format (bold, italic, code, link, strikethrough) is immediately recognizable without ambiguity. This is the level of polish expected by the design philosophy.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The overall composition in the dark Solarized theme is clean and well-structured. Headings have clear visual hierarchy through font size and weight. The code block is visually distinct with a slightly darker background. Document margins are generous and symmetric. The reading experience feels intentional and polished.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The dark theme rendering meets the charter's standard of obsessive attention to detail. The layout feels like a well-designed reading surface. The heading hierarchy is clear and the spatial rhythm between elements creates a comfortable scanning experience. This is daily-driver quality.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The light Solarized theme renders with a warm cream background and good text contrast. The code block background is clearly distinct. The blockquote left border is more visible in the light theme than in the dark theme. Typography is consistent with the dark theme. Overall layout and spacing are identical between themes.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The light theme feels equally polished. The warm Solarized Light palette creates a comfortable, paper-like reading experience. The consistency between light and dark theme spacing confirms that the spatial system is theme-independent, which is correct behavior.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The code block displays a small 'swift' language label in the top-left corner. This label appears in a lighter, smaller font and sits at the top edge of the code block.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The language label is a nice touch that adds utility. Its placement and subdued styling don't distract from the code content. It feels like an intentional design detail consistent with the charter's emphasis on getting every small element right.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Heading space above vs. below asymmetry is correctly implemented across all three heading levels. H1 has clearly more space above than below, H2 follows the same pattern, and H3 binds tightly to its following content.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The Gestalt proximity principle is well-applied. Headings clearly belong to their following content rather than floating between sections. This is a fundamental spatial design requirement and it is correctly implemented.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The HTML comment block at the top of the document is rendered as visible preformatted/code text, showing fixture metadata comments that should be hidden from the rendered preview.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: HTML comments appearing in the rendered preview contradicts the charter's principle of obsessive attention to detail. In a polished markdown viewer, HTML comments should be invisible in the rendered output. This makes the document look like a debug view rather than a finished reading experience.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Same HTML comment visibility issue in the light theme - fixture metadata comments are rendered as visible text.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Consistent with dark theme finding. HTML comments should not be visible in the rendered preview regardless of theme.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The overall document typography and heading hierarchy look clean and well-structured. The H1 'Mermaid Diagram Gallery' is appropriately large, and H2 headings ('Flowchart', 'Sequence Diagram', 'Class Diagram') maintain consistent sizing and spacing.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The text rendering and typographic hierarchy meet the charter's standard of careful design. Headings bind visually to their content sections. Vertical rhythm between sections appears consistent. This aspect is well-executed.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Theme colors are consistent throughout the document. The dark Solarized palette is properly applied with correct background and text contrast.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Theme coherence is maintained well. All visible text has good contrast against the dark background. The color palette is unified and belongs to the Solarized Dark family.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The light Solarized theme uses a warm cream/beige background with appropriate dark text. The palette is consistent and unified.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Theme coherence for the light variant is good. Text contrast is comfortable for reading. Colors all belong to the Solarized Light family.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Spacing between heading sections appears consistent between dark and light themes, suggesting theme-independent spatial layout.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Good consistency in spatial layout across themes, which is the expected behavior. The spacing between 'Flowchart', 'Sequence Diagram', and 'Class Diagram' sections appears identical in both themes.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The HTML comment block at the top of the document is rendered as visible text in a code-like block, showing fixture metadata including color hex values and rendering characteristics. This occupies a significant portion of the visible viewport.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: This is a test fixture artifact and expected for verification purposes. The rendering of the comment content as visible text may be intentional for the test harness. In production use, such HTML comments would typically not be present in user documents, so this is not a concern for daily-driver usage.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The overall dark theme rendering shows a cohesive Solarized Dark palette. The document background is the expected dark blue-gray (base03), code block background is visibly distinct and slightly lighter (base02), and text contrast is strong and comfortable for reading. The syntax tokens in the code block show distinct coloring for keywords (green for 'import', 'struct').
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The theme implementation feels polished and intentional. Color choices are harmonious within the Solarized palette. The rendering quality meets the charter's standard of careful attention to detail. The visual hierarchy between document background and code block background is clear and well-executed.

qualitativeFindings.observation: The light theme rendering shows a cohesive Solarized Light palette. The document background is the expected warm off-white (base3), code block background is visibly distinct and slightly darker (base2), and text contrast is strong. Syntax token colors in the code block are visible and distinct.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: The light theme implementation is well-executed and maintains the same level of polish as the dark theme. The warm off-white background avoids harsh pure-white glare, which is a hallmark of the Solarized palette done correctly. The overall composition feels refined and suitable for daily-driver use.

qualitativeFindings.observation: Comparing the dark and light theme screenshots, the layout structure, spacing, and element positioning appear identical. Only the color palette changes between themes. The heading sizes, code block dimensions, and vertical spacing are consistent across both themes.
qualitativeFindings.assessment: Excellent cross-theme consistency. The theme system correctly changes only colors while preserving all spatial properties. This is exactly the expected behavior per FR-7 and demonstrates a well-architected theme system where layout is decoupled from color.
